\subsection*{API CHANGE 2.0 : }

List of the scheduled changes for the GFal 2.0 API

\subsubsection*{I. BRIEF OF THE CHANGES : }

\begin{itemize}
\item POSIX API is still unchanged\item Old non-POSIX functions do not exist anymore, most of them are converted to a POSIX one ( ex : gfal\_\-ls -$>$ gfal\_\-opendir, gfal\_\-readdir; gfal\_\-turlsfromsurls -$>$ gfal\_\-getxattr )\item SRM related API is now in the gfal\_\-plugin\_\-lib. All the generic use case of the SRM API can be done with the POSIX API.\item The old confusing error system disappear for a new GError system : \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} , gfal\_\-posix\_\-print\_\-error, gfal\_\-posix\_\-strerror\_\-r\item LRC/EDG legacy support is dropped.\item Lots of the old dependencies are no more needed and are removed ( globus, gsoap, ccheck )\item gfal works now with a plugin's architecture, it is easy to add/remove a plugin for a specific URL type with the env var GFAL\_\-PLUGIN\_\-LIST ( ex : GFAL\_\-PLUGIN\_\-LIST=libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-lfc.so:libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-srm.so:libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-rfio.so )\end{itemize}


\subsubsection*{II. OFFICIAL API : }

\begin{itemize}
\item Gfal POSIX lib API:\begin{itemize}
\item the POSIX style API : \doxyref{all POSIX style function}{p.}{group__posix__group} \par
\item the Error management API\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
